alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 01 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, Charleston, Coastal Colleton, Dorchester, Inland Berkeley and Tidal Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Very heavy rainfall continues along portions of the southeast South Carolina coast this evening. Since 7 pm, 3 to 6 inches of rain has been reported across portions of western Charleston County. Rainfall will continue through at least midnight and an additional 2 to 4 inches of rain will be possible across the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley
